sub_title: Graduate of the University of Amsterdam I  Public International Law (LLM) I Dispute Settlement I Trade Law I Whisky Business
summary:
I grew up in Northern Japan and  received a master degree at the University of Amsterdam. Here's 7 things to quickly know about me. 

1.) I do love challenges. Since childhood, my motto has been, 'whenever you are in doubt, choose the one that requires greater courage.' 

2.) Eager to learn. Through news, YouTube, books, and experiences, I continually update my knowledge and skills. My recent favorites are mathematics, designs, and branding strategies. 

3.) Strong work ethics. When I set a goal, I work towards it making utmost effort. 

4.) Interest in how the world works. My Bachelor at the University of Tsukuba enabled me to follow inter-discipline courses such as international politics, law, economics, development, and environmental studies. I chose international law as a major where I find my passion and an essential role in the world. 

5.) Flexible and open-mind with a lot of self-control and discipline. That's how people describe me. 

6.) I help people. I have been involved in volunteer work in education and migration. I also support Japanese students who wish to study abroad.  

7.) Visiting more than 30 countries. I like traveling with my friends, but I also love doing it alone. One of the most memorable trips was to Uzbekistan where I met lifetime Uzbek friends and gained new insights about the world.  

Thank you for reading! I'm open to any exciting opportunities in global environment. 

Feel free to message me :)

awards:
[{'title': 'Excellent Thesis Award (A+)', 'description': 'I received the best grade for my graduation thesis: “The Individual as a Subject under International Law: Interpretation in the Jurisprudence of Japanese Courts” (written in English)

In this research, I reassessed the legal status of individuals under international law, through the study on the interpretation of Japanese courts and how the application is different between Japanese and non-Japanese nationals. 

My research involved: the legal status of individuals, the relationship between International law and domestic law, the role of international tribunals and domestic courts, the history of international law, international human rights law, the Refugee Convention, international criminal law, and the theory of international law.', 'issuer': 'University of Tsukuba', 'date': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, {'title': 'Suzuki Scholarship', 'description': 'I received Suzuki Scholarship from Sep 2020 to Mar 2022.
